methods.javadoc:
Returns the universal ID for this dataType manager
@return the universal ID for this dataType manager
methods.name: getUniversalID
methods.comment: Returns the universal ID for this dataType manager

return.comment: the universal ID for this dataType manager

methods.name: containsCategory
methods.comment: Returns true if the given category path exists in this datatype manager

return.comment: true if the given category path exists in this datatype manager

methods.name: getUniqueName
methods.comment:
Returns a unique name not currently used by any other dataType or category
 with the same baseName

params.name: baseName
params.comment: the base name to be made unique

return.comment: a unique name starting with baseName

methods.name: resolve
methods.comment:
Returns a dataType that is "in" (ie suitable implementation) this 
 Manager, creating a new one if necessary.  Also the returned dataType
 will be in a category in this dataTypeManager that is equivalent to the
 category of the passed in dataType.

params.name: handler
params.comment: used to resolve conflicts with existing dataTypes.

return.comment: an equivalent dataType that "belongs" to this dataTypeManager.

methods.name: addDataType
methods.comment:
Returns a data type after adding it to this data manager.
 The returned dataType will be in a category in this dataTypeManager
 that is equivalent to the category of the passed in dataType.

params.name: handler
params.comment: used to resolve conflicts with existing dataTypes.

return.comment: an equivalent dataType that "belongs" to this dataTypeManager.

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over all the dataTypes in this manager
@return an iterator over all the dataTypes in this manager
methods.name: getAllDataTypes
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all the dataTypes in this manager

return.comment: an iterator over all the dataTypes in this manager

methods.javadoc:
Adds all data types to the specified list.]
@param list the result list into which the types will be placed
methods.name: getAllDataTypes
methods.comment: Adds all data types to the specified list.]

params.name: list
params.comment: the result list into which the types will be placed

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over all structures in this manager
@return the iterator
methods.name: getAllStructures
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all structures in this manager

methods.javadoc:
Returns an iterator over all composite data types (structures and unions) in this manager
@return the iterator
methods.name: getAllComposites
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all composite data types (structures and unions) in this manager

methods.name: findDataTypes
methods.comment:
Begin searching at the root category for all data types with the
 given name. Places all the data types in this data type manager
 with the given name into the list.

params.name: list
params.comment: list that will be populated with matching DataType objects

methods.name: findDataTypes
methods.comment:
Begin searching at the root category for all data types with names
 that match the given name that may contain wildcards.

params.name: name
params.comment: name to match; may contain wildcards

params.name: list
params.comment: list that will be populated with matching DataType objects

params.name: caseSensitive
params.comment: true if the match is case sensitive

params.name: monitor
params.comment: task monitor to cancel the search

methods.name: replaceDataType
methods.comment:
Replace an existing dataType with another.  All instances and references will be updated to
 use the replacement dataType.

params.name: replacementDt
params.comment: the dataType to use as the replacement.

params.name: updateCategoryPath
params.comment:
if true, the replacementDt will have its categoryPath changed
 to the exitingDt's path.

throws.comment:
if the replacement datatype depends on 
 the existing dataType;

methods.javadoc:
Retrieve the data type with the fully qualified path. So you can get the data named
 "bar" in the category "foo" by calling getDataType("/foo/bar").  This method can
 be problematic now that datatype names can contain slashes.  It will work provided
 that the part of the datatype name that precedes its internal slash is not also the
 name of a category in the same category as the datatype.  For example, if you call
 getDataType("/a/b/c"), and "b/c" is the name of your datatype, it will find it unless
 there is also a category "b" under category "a".  A better solution is to use
 the {@link #getDataType(DataTypePath)} method because the DataTypePath keeps the 
 category and datatype name separate.
@param dataTypePath path
@return the dataType or null if it isn't found
methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment:
Retrieve the data type with the fully qualified path. So you can get the data named
 "bar" in the category "foo" by calling getDataType("/foo/bar").  This method can
 be problematic now that datatype names can contain slashes.  It will work provided
 that the part of the datatype name that precedes its internal slash is not also the
 name of a category in the same category as the datatype.  For example, if you call
 getDataType("/a/b/c"), and "b/c" is the name of your datatype, it will find it unless
 there is also a category "b" under category "a".  A better solution is to use
 the #getDataType(DataTypePath) method because the DataTypePath keeps the 
 category and datatype name separate.

return.comment: the dataType or null if it isn't found

methods.name: findDataType
methods.comment: Gets the dataType for the given path. See #getDataType(String) for details.

methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment: Find the dataType for the given dataTypePath.

return.comment: the datatype for the given path.

methods.name: getResolvedID
methods.comment:
Returns the dataTypeId for the given dataType.  If the dataType is not 
 currently in the dataTypeManger, it will be added

return.comment: the ID of the resolved type

methods.name: getID
methods.comment:
Returns the dataTypeId for the given dataType.  If the dataType does not exist,
 a -1 will be returned

params.name: dt
params.comment: the datatype to get an id for

methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment:
Returns the dataType associated with the given dataTypeId or null if the dataTypeId is 
 not valid

methods.name: getCategory
methods.comment: Returns the Category with the given id

methods.name: getCategory
methods.comment: Get the category that has the given path

methods.javadoc:
Notification when data type is changed.
@param dataType data type that is changed
methods.name: dataTypeChanged
methods.comment: Notification when data type is changed.

methods.javadoc:
Add a listener that is notified when the dataTypeManger changes.
@param l the listener
methods.name: addDataTypeManagerListener
methods.comment: Add a listener that is notified when the dataTypeManger changes.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the DataTypeManger change listener.
@param l the listener
methods.name: removeDataTypeManagerListener
methods.comment: Remove the DataTypeManger change listener.

methods.javadoc:
Adds a listener that will be notified when this manager's cache is invalidated.  This will
 happen when the system has changed and the manager cannot determine the exact change, like
 during an undo or a redo.
@param listener The listener to add
methods.name: addInvalidatedListener
methods.comment:
Adds a listener that will be notified when this manager's cache is invalidated.  This will
 happen when the system has changed and the manager cannot determine the exact change, like
 during an undo or a redo.

methods.javadoc:
Removes a previously added InvalidatedListener
@param listener the listener to remove.
methods.name: removeInvalidatedListener
methods.comment: Removes a previously added InvalidatedListener

methods.name: remove
methods.comment: Remove the given datatype from this manager

return.comment: true if the data type existed and was removed

methods.name: contains
methods.comment: Return true if the given dataType exists in this data type manager

return.comment: true if the type is in this manager

methods.name: createCategory
methods.comment: Create a category for the given path; returns the current category if it already exits

methods.name: getDataType
methods.comment: Gets the data type with the indicated name in the indicated category.

methods.javadoc:
Returns this data type manager's name
@return the name
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Returns this data type manager's name

methods.name: setName
methods.comment: Sets this data type manager's name

throws.comment: if the given name is invalid (such as when null or empty)

methods.name: startTransaction
methods.comment: Starts a transaction for making changes in this data type manager.

params.name: description
params.comment: a short description of the changes to be made.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this DataTypeManager can be modified.
@return true if this DataTypeMangaer can be modified.
methods.name: isUpdatable
methods.comment: Returns true if this DataTypeManager can be modified.

return.comment: true if this DataTypeMangaer can be modified.

methods.name: endTransaction
methods.comment: Ends the current transaction

params.name: transactionID
params.comment: id of the transaction to end

params.name: commit
params.comment: true if changes are committed, false if changes in transaction are revoked

methods.javadoc:
Force all pending notification events to be flushed
@throws IllegalStateException if the client is holding this object's lock
methods.name: flushEvents
methods.comment: Force all pending notification events to be flushed

methods.javadoc: Closes this dataType manager
methods.name: close
methods.comment: Closes this dataType manager

methods.name: getPointer
methods.comment:
Returns a default sized pointer to the given datatype.  The pointer size is established
 dynamically based upon the data organization established by the compiler specification.

methods.name: getPointer
methods.comment:
Returns a pointer of the given size to the given datatype.
 Note: It is preferred to use default sized pointers when possible (i.e., size=-1, 
 see #getPointer(DataType)) instead of explicitly specifying the size value.

params.name: size
params.comment: the size of the pointer to be created or -1 for a default sized pointer

methods.javadoc:
Returns the root category Manager
@return the category
methods.name: getRootCategory
methods.comment: Returns the root category Manager

methods.name: isFavorite
methods.comment:
Returns true if the given datatype has been designated as a favorite. If the datatype
 does not belong to this datatype manager, then false will be returned.

return.comment: true if the given datatype is a favorite in this manager.

methods.name: setFavorite
methods.comment: Sets the given dataType to be either a favorite or not a favorite.

params.name: datatype
params.comment: the datatype for which to change its status as a favorite.

params.name: isFavorite
params.comment: true if the datatype is to be a favorite or false otherwise.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of datatypes that have been designated as favorites.
@return the list of favorite datatypes in this manager.
methods.name: getFavorites
methods.comment: Returns a list of datatypes that have been designated as favorites.

return.comment: the list of favorite datatypes in this manager.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the total number of data type categories
@return the count
methods.name: getCategoryCount
methods.comment: Returns the total number of data type categories

methods.name: getDataTypeCount
methods.comment: Returns the total number of defined data types.

params.name: includePointersAndArrays
params.comment: if true all pointers and array data types will be included

methods.name: findEnumValueNames
methods.comment: Adds all enum value names that match the given value, to the given set.

params.name: value
params.comment: the value to look for enum name matches

params.name: enumValueNames
params.comment: the set to add matches to.

methods.name: findDataTypeForID
methods.comment: Get's the data type with the matching universal data type id.

params.name: datatypeID
params.comment: The universal id of the data type to search for

return.comment: The data type with the matching UUID, or null if no such data type can be found.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the timestamp of the last time this manager was changed
@return the timestamp
methods.name: getLastChangeTimeForMyManager
methods.comment: Returns the timestamp of the last time this manager was changed

methods.name: getSourceArchive
methods.comment: Returns the source archive for the given ID

return.comment: the archive; null if the ID is null; null if the archive does not exist

methods.javadoc:
Returns this manager's archive type
@return the type
methods.name: getType
methods.comment: Returns this manager's archive type

methods.name: getDataTypes
methods.comment: Returns all data types within this manager that have as their source the given archive

methods.javadoc:
Returns the source archive for this manager
@return the archive; null if the ID is null; null if the archive does not exist
methods.name: getLocalSourceArchive
methods.comment: Returns the source archive for this manager

return.comment: the archive; null if the ID is null; null if the archive does not exist

methods.name: associateDataTypeWithArchive
methods.comment: Change the given data type so that its source archive is the given archive

methods.name: disassociate
methods.comment:
If the indicated data type is associated with a source archive, this will remove the 
 association and the data type will become local to this data type manager.

params.name: datatype
params.comment: the data type to be disassociated from a source archive.

methods.name: updateSourceArchiveName
methods.comment: Updates the name associated with a source archive in this data type manager.

params.name: archiveFileID
params.comment: Universal domain file ID of the source data type archive that has a new name.

params.name: name
params.comment: the new name of the program or archive.

return.comment:
true if the name associated with the source data type archive was changed.
 false if it wasn't changed.

methods.name: updateSourceArchiveName
methods.comment: Updates the name associated with a source archive in this data type manager.

params.name: sourceID
params.comment: Universal archive ID of the source data type archive that has a new name.

params.name: name
params.comment: the new name of the program or archive.

return.comment:
true if the name associated with the source data type archive was changed.
 false if it wasn't changed.

methods.name: getDataOrganization
methods.comment:
Get the data organization associated with this data type manager.  Note that the 
 DataOrganization settings may not be changed dynamically.

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of source archives not including the builtin or the program's archive.
@return a list of source archives not including the builtin or the program's archive.
methods.name: getSourceArchives
methods.comment: Returns a list of source archives not including the builtin or the program's archive.

return.comment: a list of source archives not including the builtin or the program's archive.

methods.name: removeSourceArchive
methods.comment:
Removes the source archive from this manager.  This will disassociate all data types in
 this manager from the given archive.

methods.name: resolveSourceArchive
methods.comment: Returns or creates a persisted version of the given source archive

methods.name: getDataTypesContaining
methods.comment: Returns the data types within this data type manager that contain the specified data type.

return.comment: a set of data types that contain the specified data type.

fields.javadoc: ID for the default (undefined) data type.
fields.name: DEFAULT_DATATYPE_ID
fields.comment: ID for the default (undefined) data type.

fields.javadoc: ID if data type type is not known in this data type manager.
fields.name: NULL_DATATYPE_ID
fields.comment: ID if data type type is not known in this data type manager.

fields.javadoc: ID if data type type is BAD.
fields.name: BAD_DATATYPE_ID
fields.comment: ID if data type type is BAD.

fields.javadoc: Name of the category for the build in data types.
fields.name: BUILT_IN_DATA_TYPES_NAME
fields.comment: Name of the category for the build in data types.
